candidate Profile Description.summary: Dhiraj Pimparkar is a Data Science specialist with strong programming skills. He has a wealth of experience as a Deep Learning intern and has participated in multiple academic projects. Former graduate teaching assistant with an ability to communicate technical concepts effectively.

education.degree: Master of Science, Computational Data Science
relevant_coursework: Applied Decision Theory and Bayesian Statistics

education.institution: Indian Institute of Technology, Jammu (IIT), India

certifications: Mathematics for Machine Learning: Multivariate Calculus, Coursera (2021)
Neural Networks and Deep Learning, Coursera (2021)

experience.company: Luddy School of Informatics, and Computing, USA
experience.title: Graduate Teaching Assistant
responsibilities: Supported Dr. Sunandan Chakraborty’s H518: Deep Learning course, serving 45 students by grading assignments, con-ducting 6 lab classes, and leading 12 classroom discussions.
Assisted students, addressing over 100 queries, offering coursework guidance, and designing 10 effective lesson plans covering topics such as RNNs, CNNs, LSTMs, and Feed-forward Neural Networks.

experience.title: Deep Learning Intern
responsibilities: Developed a high-speed ball-tracking system using YOLOv8 object detection for multiple ball types, achieving a mean average precision (mAP@50) of 0.81.
Improved the system’s performance (metric: mAP@50) by 12% using a custom-generated dataset developed with alpha bending technique and Gaussian filters.

experience.title: Project Intern
responsibilities: Implemented an Excel VBA add-in macro, automating a product’s non-delivery cost rate calculation based on product priority and customer requirement, reducing calculation time by more than 30%.
Engineered a robust Python interface to seamlessly retrieve data from SAP IBP, facilitate efficient data exchange, and send back forecasted data using proprietary algorithms to the database.

experience.company: Mahindra Group Technology Office, Worli Office, Mumbai
experience.title: Data Science Intern
responsibilities: Proposed a scalable entity resolution model based on active learning (to train a logistic regression model), blocking strategy, and hierarchical clustering for a database of 8 million customers.
Reduced the prediction processing time of the previous rule-based method by a factor of 1/4 on custom-made test data.

experience.company: University of New South Wales, Sydney, Australia
experience.title: Deep Learning Intern
responsibilities: Addressed class imbalance in ML/DL datasets by combining two different techniques of SMOTE and GANs, achieving about 2-3% improvement in F1 scores for classification tasks on oversampled test datasets.

Trained and optimized CNN and MLP models for predicting alteration zones, a geological feature, using hyperspectral remote sensing data, achieving the highest F1 score of 0.91, beating the benchmark ML models deployed for the same application.

projects.name: Autonomous Weeding Robot
projects.description: Designed an autonomous robot capable of uprooting weeds in cotton fields to minimize manual labor & operational costs. Implemented an efficient autonomous path traversal using informed search (A* algorithm) with custom heuristics for maximum weed removal. Developed a computer vision model to identify weed using a YOLOv7 object detector, achieving mAP@50 of 0.67.

projects.name: Prediction of CHF Location Through Applied Machine Learning
projects.description: Conceptualized locating areas of CHF in annular geometries by mitigating risks of overheating using ML methods by replacing the manual calculation procedures & reducing the processing time by over 80%. Improved performance with feature selection methods of mRMR and PCA to achieve an R2 score of 0.90 with SVM and 0.9404 with ANN.

achievements.summary: National Winner of the Smart India Hackathon '22 among 40 teams across India in the problem statement - “Fishing Boat Activity Clustering and Time Studying”, winning a cash prize worth INR 100k
Recipient of Means-Cum-Merit scholarship by IIT Jammu awarded to meritorious students.
Won Silver Medal at Inter IIT Tech Meet 9.0 for “The Product Folks and Kaching’s Case Study” among 23 IITs.
Recipient of NTSE scholarship awarded to the top 1000 students among 9 lakh candidates by the Government of India.
